byline.contributor: Sophia Kishkovsky contributed reporting from Moscow.

abstract: Grace Notes column; nationalistic Russians are calling for remains of Russian-born composer Sergei Rachmaninoff, who died in United States, to be moved to his homeland, against his descendants' wishes; Rachmaninoff is buried in Kensico Cemetery in Valhalla, NY.
lead_paragraph: Russia’s culture minister said recently that the remains of the composer Sergei Rachmaninoff, who was born in Russia but died in the United States, should be moved to his homeland.

headline.main: Family Balks at Talk by Russia to Move Rachmaninoff’s Remains
headline.print_headline: A Dispute Over a Composer’s Burial Place, and His Legacy

snippet: Russia’s culture minister said recently that the remains of the composer Sergei Rachmaninoff, who was born in Russia but died in the United States, should be moved to his homeland.
